title: Mass Release
content:
• Home
  • ››Manhattan Active® Omni
  • ››Order Management
  • ››Process & Configuration Guides
  • ››Order Processing

  • ››Order Release
  • ››Mass Release

Mass Release

Previous I Next

 

  • Order Processing: Mass Action
    • Mass Action Request
    • Mass Action
    • Mass Action Response

Order Processing: Mass Action

Order(s) that were previously not released due to technical failures can be processed for release again. A new API is exposed to reprocess the release, for the list of orders filtered based on the request query. The release process is triggered and the orders are processed asynchronously. 

Mass Action Request

  • Mass Action Request can be initiated via calling the API directly or through Adhoc request from Order List UI
    • On the Order List UI, filter the orders by applying search criteria and click the 'Release All' button
      • Prerequisite for the button enablement - 
        • Mandatory search criteria
        • Orders should be filtered based on search criteria
    • User should have required permission else hard check error is thrown on click of the button. Refer here for permission detail.
  • Call the API directly: Use the following API,

    • <url>/order/api/order/order/massAction - POST method to mass release order(s). Prerequisite for the API to accept the request is to have the permission api::order::transaction::admin.

Mass Release sample request

{
"Query": "((MaxFulfillmentStatusId=2000 AND MinFulfillmentStatusId=2000))",
"MassAction" : "Release"
}

If a previous mass release job is "InProgress" then additional requests for mass action is rejected. The current job should complete successfully or should be aborted to accept any further request.

Abort Order Mass Action Job

URL - "/scheduler/api/scheduler/jobExecution/uniqueJobId/{uniqueJobId}"
Body Request - 
{
    "Status": "aborted"
}

Mass Action

Mass Action "Release" processing is similar to batch release refer here on batch release for more details.

Mass Action Response

Once the request is accepted, the API initiates the release service and provides the end user with a Job Schedule Id in the response.

Mass Release sample response

{
"success": true,
"header": null,
"data": {
"Messages": null,
"MassAction": "Release",
"JobScheduleId": "js95391076296076581202358"
},
"messageKey": null,
"message": "Order Mass Action Request Received",
"errors": [],
"exceptions": [],
"messages": {
"Message": [],
"Size": 0
},
"rootCause": null,
"requestUri": null,
"statusCode": "OK"
}

The status of a job can be monitored based on the Job Schedule Id either by calling the below API or navigating through MUP Monitor Scheduled Jobs UI and filtering the job list with the Job Scheduled Id.

Order Mass Action Job Status sample request

{{url}}/scheduler/api/scheduler/jobExecution/search

Body Request -
{
"Query": "JobTypeId=orderMassActionJob",
"Sort": [{"attribute": "CreatedTimestamp","direction": "desc"}]
}
Body Request -
{
"Query": "JobScheduleId=js95391076296076581202359",
"Sort": [{"attribute": "CreatedTimestamp","direction": "desc"}]
}

Order Mass Action Job Status sample response

If the Job is success, but the order(s) are not released then enable below functional logs to trouble shoot release failure or verify troubleshoot UI to find out why order was not released.

Enable Functional Logs for Release Troubleshooting

{{url}}/order/component/logLevel
Body Request -
{
"loggerName":"com.manh.cp.app.logging.logger.release.ReleaseLogger",
"logLevel":"TRACE"
}
